recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken breasts, cooked and sliced
method: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package directions.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Add cooked chicken to the sauce and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over cooked fettuccine pasta.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
method: Cook egg noodles according to package directions.
Coat beef slices in flour.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add beef slices to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
Add beef broth to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and stir in sour cream until heated through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over cooked egg noodles.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
method: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned and cooked through,about 8-10 minutes.
Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and red wine to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in chopped parsley and basil, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over cooked spaghetti.

recipes.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
method: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce and cornstarch.
In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add sliced beef to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add broccoli florets to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, until slightly tender.
Add beef broth to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Stir in the soy sauce mixture and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Chicken Parmesan
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a shallow dish, combine breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumb mixture.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to a baking dish and pour marinara sauce over the top.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the top of the chicken.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with chopped fresh basil before serving.

recipes.title: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
method: Cook linguine pasta according to package directions.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink and cooked through, about 3-5 minutes.
Add white wine and lemon juice to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in chopped parsley, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over cooked linguine pasta.

recipes.title: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Taco toppings: shredded lettuce, chopped tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa
method: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.
Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper, and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Warm tortillas in a microwave or on a griddle.
Assemble tacos by filling each tortilla with the beef mixture and toppings of your choice.
Serve hot.
